suppress.notes: The CVE-2018-1258 occurs from spring security libraries, despite the latest versions are used. This is confirmed as false positive and hence it is suppressed (https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/2952)
CVE-2021-28170 https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-28170 Spring Framework vulnerability, subject to review after Spring Boot upgrade to 2.4.x affected lib org.glassfish:jakarta.el:3.0.3

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-22096#range-7096083 Temporary suppression until upgrade to Spring Boot 2.5.6 (current) https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/reference/html/dependency-versions.html#dependency-versions
Fix until the import for logback are updated
Major liquibase update to version 4.8.0+ needed, this will require code refactoring
jackson-databind issue, upgrading to new version broke functional tests.
Spring MVC or Spring WebFlux CVE that is currently awaiting analysis on NIST.
Awaiting version of Spring-core with a fix for the following CVE issue.
Awaiting version of Spring-core with a fix for the following CVE issue.
Awaiting version of Tomcat Embed Core with a fix for the following CVE issue. 9.0.64 is most recent and still has the cve issue.

Versions of the Amazon AWS Apache Log4j hotpatch package before log4j-cve-2021-44228-hotpatch-1.3.5 are affected by a race condition that could lead to a local privilege escalation. CVE-2022-33915 occured, despite latest versions used.
